thread.title: TRAVEL: Lines reopened but disruption expected until end of service | Tyne Tees
thread.title_full: TRAVEL: Lines reopened but disruption expected until end of service | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: TRAVEL: Lines reopened but disruption expected until end of service | Tyne Tees
text:
Virgin Trains East Coast says all lines affected by signalling problems at Darlington have reopened but disruption is expected until the end of service.
Virgin Trains EC @Virgin_TrainsEC Follow #VTECUpdate All lines have reopened following tonights vandalism, however the knock-on effect will cause disruption until the end of service
19:54 - 4 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite The disruption has been caused by a signalling problem at Darlington. Network Rail says the signalling problem is due to vandalism.
Trains have not been running between York and Newcastle via Darlignton. Some trains have been diverted via Sunderland.
Tickets dated today will be accepted on services tomorrow. Passengers will be allowed to travel with any rail company through the affected area.
Last updated Fri 4 Sep 2015 Travel Virgin Trains East Coast Main Line Railway Newcastle County Durham Teesside Durham York
